page.title: 17A WALK UP THE EILDON HILLS
page.content: On Wednesday 12th of June,Chris,Jamie, Jason,and Paul walked up the{Eildon {Hills.}There are three hills and they used to be {volcanoes.}When we went up it was a windy and cloudy day.The {Eildons}are very steep and because they are covered in heather it makes it harder to climb.When you get to the top of the{middle Eildon}<if its a clear day> you can see the{Forth Road {Bridge and Rail Bridge }in{Edinburgh, {about 40 miles away.Looking south in {similar conditions the}border hills between Scotland and England can be spotted at the{Carter Bar.}A glance downwards brings{Melrose Golf Club into view.A public{Shooting Range}sits behind the golf course,and extending the eye further north, the towns of {Tweedbank and Galashiels}are visible. While the{foothills}of the{Eildons}are used for grazing,grass snakes abound.
